did.unittitle: League of Women Voters of the Ann Arbor Area records 1920-1993
did.abstract: Administrative and organizational records; files relating to elections and local and state issues.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The records came from the League (donor no. 5056) and from individual League officers in multiple accessions.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, League of Women Voters of the Ann Arbor Area records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The early history of what is now known as the League of Women Voters of the Ann Arbor Area is uncertain. According to some accounts, this chapter of the League was first organized in 1920 as a by-product of the woman's suffrage movement. Meetings were held in the high school building. For much of the 1920s, however, except for an occasional speaker, the organization was inactive. In November 1934, the Ann Arbor chapter was reorganized and with approval of the state office the reorganized league chapter was given encouragement to act as a clearinghouse of governmental and political information to be taken to local civic organizations. Issues of concern to the league in these years included maternal health, child welfare, civil service reform, and problems arising out of the depression.

During the war years, the Ann Arbor League directed its energies toward the revision of the city's charter and the various activities that came to be known as Voter Service. To help the citizenry make informed choices, League members now began gathering and distributing information about the candidates running for local elections, about ballot proposals, and about legislation pending before the state legislature or the U.S. Congress.

In 1974, the Ann Arbor and Ypsilanti League chapters merged to form the League of Women Voters of the Ann Arbor Area. The purpose of the league today continues to be the promotion of political responsibility in government. Voter education remains its primary emphasis. As a nonpartisan group, the League does not take a position on political parties or candidates, only on issues, and only after its members have made a thorough study of the issue and reached consensus.

scopecontent.p: The records of the League of Women Voters of the Ann Arbor Area have been arranged into the following series: Organizational Records, 1942-1966 (mainly Mrs. Ivan Duff files); Health Care and Planning Issues, 1966-1973; Administrative, 1920-1990; Elections, 1946-1982; Issues, 1944-1981: and Topical files, 1969-1983. As the records came from different donors, there is some inevitable overlap between the various series.

controlaccess.subject: City planning--Michigan--Ann Arbor.
Elections--Michigan--Ann Arbor.
Hospitals--Michigan--Ann Arbor.
Municipal government--Michigan.

controlaccess.corpname: League of Women Voters of the Ann Arbor Area.

scopecontent.p: The Organizational Records series were files accumulated by Mrs. Ivan Duff. Subject include the state constitutional convention of 1961-1962 and the revision of Ann Arbor's city charter as proposed, discussed, and realized in the period of 1948 to 1955.

The Health Care and Planning Issues series consists primarily of reports, memoranda, and clippings relating to the status and reorganization of health care services in Washtenaw County in the period of 1966 to 1973. Some of the subjects covered in the files concern the controversy of the relocation of St. Joseph Mercy Hospital, family planning, medical services to the disadvantaged, and adult foster care homes.

did.unittitle: Grant proposal, "Senior Citizen Therapy and Day Care Center," 1971
Clippings largely concerning hospitals and health care 1966-1973

scopecontent.p: The Administrative series (1920-1990) series includes runs of annual reports, board minutes, and the League's newsletter.

did.unittitle: Annual reports to state office 1947-1981 (some gaps)
Annual reports of vice presidents, committees, etc. 1951-1978
Annual reports of voters service unit 1961-1970

scopecontent.p: The Elections series (1946-1982) contain the most complete file of materials relating to city elections - to the council, for mayor, the school board, ballot proposals, etc. This series includes voter's guide materials, clippings, and various informational files.

did.unittitle: Ann Arbor city income tax relief 1969

scopecontent.p: The Issues series (1940-1981) is arranged alphabetically by topic.

did.unittitle: Budget and financing of city of Ann Arbor 1968-1971

scopecontent.p: The Topical files series (1969-1983) represents an accumulation of records from different LWV officers. The bulk of the files relate to the litigation of the League against the city of Ann Arbor and the Ann Arbor Transportation Authority over alleged misuse of AATA funds.

did.unittitle: Ann Arbor city annexation policy (general) and relating to Smokler--Murphy property 1970-1974
United States Congress (consensus on reform of Congress) 1970-1971, undated
